page.title: 10Ampleforth College farm.
page.content: Almost all the land from Shallowdale down beyond Little Holbeck stream is owned by the college farm. The land is quite fertile and usually produces a good harvest. Dairy cows are the only livestock kept: these provide milk and yoghurt for Ampleforth College. The farm grows wheat, barley, oil seed rape and silage which is used as winter fodder. The farm has three cuts of silage per year plus one cut of hay from the rugby pitches. The farming in the valley is generally rather hard because of the heavy soil which needs drainage. In the valley there is a purpose built Ice-Rink drained from the crop fields. This is commonly known as the 'flooded field'. The farm has modern machinery using New Holland Combines because of their reliability and local suppliers. { Interview-College Farm Manager.
